- The latest update to Firebase includes the following:

 - Kotlin extension libraries for many Firebase Android SDKs are now out of
 beta! These ktx libraries enable you to access Firebase Android APIs using
 idiomatic Kotlin syntax. Learn more about these ktx libraries in the
 [Android -- Kotlin reference documentation](https://developers.google.com/docs/reference/kotlin/packages).
- The latest update to the
[OSS licenses Gradle plugin](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/opensource#add_the_gradle_plugin)
includes fixes for the following issues:

 - Failure to find any licenses when a library project is present
 ( [GitHub Issue #119](https://github.com/google/play-services-plugins/issues/119))
 - Ambiguous method overloading when POM file cannot be resolved
 ( [GitHub Issue #120](https://github.com/google/play-services-plugins/issues/120))

## December 05, 2019
- Updates to the `play-services-cast` and `play-services-cast-framework`
libraries include:

 - Added
 [`setMediaSessionEnabled`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/CastMediaOptions.Builder#setMediaSessionEnabled(boolean))
 to enable and disable a media session created by the Cast SDK.
 - Changed how media notifications show during a Cast session. If media
 notification is enabled, it will always show during a Cast session.
 Previously, it would only show when the app was in the background.
 - Changed some media-related classes to implement a
 [`Parcelable`](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Parcelable)
 interface.

- Updates to the `play-services-cast` and `play-services-cast-framework`
libraries include:


 - Added `MediaError` field to `RemoteMediaClient.MediaChannelResult` that
 can be used to access the detailed error code for failed media commands.
 - The `MediaStatus.COMMAND_SKIP_FORWARD` and `MediaStatus.COMMAND_SKIP_BACKWARD` are deprecated. Apps should use `MediaStatus.COMMAND_QUEUE_NEXT` and `MediaStatus.COMMAND_QUEUE_PREVIOUS` instead.

## August 27, 2019
- Updates to the Google Play Services Wallet SDK include:

 - Removal of the deprecated Android Pay APIs and associated symbols:

 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.Cart`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.CountrySpecification`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.EnableWalletOptimizationReceiver`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.FullWallet`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.FullWalletRequest`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.LineItem`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.MaskedWallet`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.MaskedWalletRequest`
 - Class `com.google.android.gms.wallet.ProxyCard`
 - Field `com.google.android.gms.wallet.Wallet#Payments`
 - Field `com.google.android.gms.wallet.WalletConstants#Payments`
 - Interface `com.google.android.gms.wallet.Payments`
 - Package `com.google.android.gms.wallet.fragment`
 - Deprecation of the non-JSON methods in Google Pay API objects as well as
 the non-JSON builders. Instead of the deprecated symbols, use the
 JSON-based API described in

## August 22, 2019
- The [`google-services` plugin](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/google-services-plugin)
for Android (v4.3.1) is now available. This release removes calls to a
deprecated API. For more information, refer to the
[Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#2019-08-22).

- The v18.0.0 release of Google Play services Fitness has the following breaking
changes:

 - Deprecated the following GoogleApiClient-based APIs:
 - `BleApi`
 - `ConfigApi`
 - `GoalsApi`
 - `HistoryApi`
 - `RecordingApi`
 - `SensorsApi`
 - `SessionsApi`
 - Removed the following deprecated DataTypes:
 - `AGGREGATE_CALORIES_CONSUMED`
 - `AGGREGATE_INPUT_TYPES`
 - `TYPE_ACTIVITY_SAMPLE`
 - `TYPE_CALORIES_CONSUMED`
 - Removed the deprecated method `fromLocationRequest` from `SensorRequest`.
 - Added builders for `DataPoint` and `DataSet`.

## August 07, 2019
- Updates to `play-services-base` and `play-services-basement` libraries
include:

 - Deprecated `GoogleApiClient.ConnectionCallbacks` and
 `GoogleApiClient.OnConnectionFailedListener`. This is a follow-up to the
 [`GoogleApi`-based replacements to\
 `GoogleApiClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/google-api-client).
 - Improved builder-based
 [`AccountPicker.newChooseAccountIntent`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/AccountPicker#newChooseAccountIntent(AccountPicker.AccountChooserOptions))
 method.
 - Fixed potential crashes in
 [`GoogleApiAvailability#makeGooglePlayServicesAvailable`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/GoogleApiAvailability#makeGooglePlayServicesAvailable(android.app.Activity)).
- Updates to the `com.google.android.gms:play-services-awareness` library
include deprecation of the following methods from
[`Awareness#SnapshotClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotClient):


 - [`getPlaces()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotClient#getPlaces())
 - [`getWeather()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotClient#getWeather())

This release fixes the compatibility issue with the
`com.google.android.gms:play-services-awareness:17.0.0` release described in
the [July 02, 2019 release note](https://developers.google.com/developers.google.com#july_02_2019). The workaround of using the
pre-Jetpack `com.google.android.gms:play-services-awareness:16.0.0` is no
longer necessary. **The**
**`com.google.android.gms:play-services-awareness:**17.0.0**` release should not**
**be used.**

## December 18, 2018
- Updated the FIDO2 API according to the latest WebAuthn spec.
Developers can use the FIDO2 APIS to strongly authenticate their users with
two types of authenticators: external U2F authenticators and the supported
device-resident "embedded" authenticator.
- Removed constructors from [`Fido2ApiClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/Fido2ApiClient) and [`Fido2PrivilegedApiClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/Fido2PrivilegedApiClient). These classes should be instantiated through the static
factories in [`Fido`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/Fido).
- Renamed `MakeCredentialOptions` and `BrowserMakeCredentialOptions` to [`PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/PublicKeyCredentialCreationOptions) and
and [`BrowserPublicKeyCredentialCreationOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/BrowserPublicKeyCredentialCreationOptions) respectively.
- Augmented [`RequestOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/RequestOptions) with an [`AuthenticationExtensions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AuthenticationExtensions)
member that allows the caller to dictate client-side behavior when conducting a
registration or authentication ceremony. Currently, only the [`FidoAppIdExtension`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/FidoAppIdExtension)
is supported. Over time, more extensions may be supported depending on
the use case.
- Added Builder for [`AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AuthenticatorSelectionCriteria).
- Changed Builders for [`PublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/PublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions), [`BrowserPublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/BrowserPublicKeyCredentialRequestOptions).
- Removed Builders for API response-level objects [`AuthenticatorAttestationResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AuthenticatorAttestationResponse), [`AuthenticatorAssertionResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AuthenticatorAssertionResponse), [`AuthenticatorErrorResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AuthenticatorErrorResponse).
- Added enumerations of RSA and EC2 algorithms from the COSE registry to employ in [`PublicKeyCredentialParameters`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/PublicKeyCredentialParameters).
- Added [`AttestationConveyancePreference`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/AttestationConveyancePreference),
which specifies the level of obfuscation of the attestation object returned in a registration ceremony.
- Renamed and restructured the former TokenBindingIdValue to [`TokenBinding`](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/TokenBinding).
- Augmented and/or updated other data structures to represent WebAuthn draft [WD11](https://www.w3.org/TR/2018/CR-webauthn-20180807/).
For instance, the "user id" field in [`PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity`](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fido/fido2/api/common/PublicKeyCredentialUserEntity)
has been updated to be a `byte[]` rather than a

#### Known Issue with October 2, 2018 release
Some of the libraries in the [October 2, 2018 release](https://developers.google.com/developers.google.com#october_2_2018)
contained an issue in their POM dependencies. This most likely manifests as dex
merge issues when some dependency version is updated (even when using the
[`strict-version-matcher-plugin`](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/versioning#standalone_version_matcher_plugin)).
To resolve, update to the `Recommended Minimum Version` as follows:

| com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads | 16.0.0 | 17.1.1 |

| com.google.android.gms:play-services-cast | 16.0.3 | 16.1.0 |

| com.google.android.gms:play-services-gass | 16.0.0 | 17.1.1 |
| com.google.android.gms:play-services-measurement-api | 16.0.2 | 16.0.3 |
| com.google.android.gms:play-services-measurement-base | 16.0.3 | 16.0.4 |
| com.google.android.gms:play-services-measurement-sdk-api | 16.0.2 | 16.0.3 |

#### Ads
- Fixed a bug where certain combinations of `play-services-ads` &
`firebase-analytics` (e.g., `ads:17.1.0` & `analytics:16.0.5`) resulted in a
`duplicate entry` compiler error. Publishers using `firebase-analytics` along
with version `17.1.1` of any of the ads library (e.g.,
`com.google.android.gms:play-services-ads:17.1.1`) must use
`com.google.firebase:firebase-analytics:16.0.5`.

## October 9, 2018
- Refactored the strict-version-matcher-plugin dependency analysis to present
a better error messaging when conflicting artifact versions are identified.
The error messages now include project names and intra-project dependency
names, to help you identify which of your declared dependencies are causing
errors.
- Fixed bugs in the plugin related to multi-module and parallel builds.

#### Artifacts released on maven.google.com
- com.google.android.gms:strict-version-matcher-plugin:1.1.0

#### Ads
- Added new requirement for a ` ` tag in AndroidManifest.xml:
 - Google AdMob publishers are required to specify a ` ` tag with key
 `com.google.android.gms.ads.APPLICATION_ID`. See the [AdMob getting started\
 guide](https://developers.google.com/admob/android/quick-start#update_your_androidmanifestxml)
 for more details.
 - Google Ad Manager publishers are required to specify a ` ` tag
 with key `com.google.android.gms.ads.AD_MANAGER_APP`. See the [Ad Manager\
 getting started guide](https://developers.google.com/ad-manager/mobile-ads-sdk/android/quick-start#update_your_androidmanifestxml)
 for more details.
- Native ads: [`NativeAppInstallAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeAppInstallAd),
[`NativeContentAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeContentAd),
and associated APIs are deprecated in favor of
[`UnifiedNativeAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/UnifiedNativeAd).
See [Native Ads Advanced Unified](https://developers.google.com/admob/android/native-unified) for further
instructions on using the new APIs.
- Native ads: Added the "Mute this Ad" feature.
- Native ads: The benign warning log: â€œUnconfirmedClickListener must not be null while ClickConfirmingView is set.â€ has been removed.
- Rewarded ads: Calling [`destroy()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/reward/RewardedVideoAd#destroy(android.content.Context))
will null out the listener.
- Deprecated the following methods on [`AdRequest.Builder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdRequest.Builder).
 - [`setGender()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdRequest.Builder#setGender(int))
 - [`setBirthday()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdRequest.Builder#setBirthday(java.util.Date))
 - [`setIsDesignedForFamiles()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdRequest.Builder#setIsDesignedForFamilies(boolean))
- Fixed a bug where
[`onRewardedVideoCompleted()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/reward/RewardedVideoAdListener#onRewardedVideoCompleted())
wasnâ€™t firing on emulators.

#### Core libraries minor feature updates.
- Minor internal feature updates were made to some core libraries
(play-services-auth, play-services-base, play-services-basement,
play-services-flags, play-services-stats, play-services-tasks) used by other
Google Play services libraries.
- The strict interdependencies between the core libraries were relaxed so that
minor and patch versions can be used individually. Previously the POM files
for these libraries specified their dependencies at exact versions, which
complicates resolution of dependencies.
- The core library dependency changes necessitated releasing a full set of
libraries that have updated versions in their POM dependencies. Non-core
libraries do not have any external changes except to update their transitive
dependencies.
- Bug fixes and internal improvements to firebase-database and
firebase-firestore.

## September 26, 2018
The v16.0.0 release of Google Play services Fitness provides access to two new
data types and their respective aggregates:

- [`TYPE_HEART_POINTS`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/DataType#TYPE_HEART_POINTS)
- [`AGGREGATE_HEART_POINTS`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/DataType#AGGREGATE_HEART_POINTS)
- [`TYPE_MOVE_MINUTES`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/DataType#TYPE_MOVE_MINUTES)
- [`AGGREGATE_MOVE_MINUTES`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/DataType#AGGREGATE_MOVE_MINUTES)

#### Version Ranges Removed
Starting with the 15.0.0 release of Google Play services and Firebase,
inter-library dependencies were defined using [version\
ranges](https://maven.apache.org/pom.html#Dependency_Version_Requirement_Specification)
in the POMs. This affected the build reproducibility of projects using these
libraries. As an example, Gradle's [dependency\
resolution](https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/introduction_dependency_management.html#sec:dependency_resolution)
will attempt to use the highest available concrete version in a repository,
causing uplift of a dependency version without any changes to the project
itself.

The use of version ranges was a mistake and has been corrected; Google Play
services and Firebase dependencies will no longer use version ranges. However,
existing, published library POM files already contain ranges. Thus, all future
library updates will need to start outside the dependency ranges of previously
published libraries.

Example:

- If `play-services-bar` had a dependency onto `play-services-foo` with range
`[15.0.0, 16.0.0)`, a new release of `play-services-foo` must begin with
`16.0.0` to be outside this range.
- Any future releases of `play-services-bar` will declare a ["soft"\
requirement](https://maven.apache.org/pom.html#Dependency_Version_Requirement_Specification)
onto a single version of `play-services-foo`.
- Any future release of `play-services-foo` will follow SemVer.

#### Firebase

Learning. For more information, see [Firebase Android SDK Release\
Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20180523).
- Firebase now requires the app gradle file to explicitly list
`com.google.firebase:firebase-core` as a dependency for Firebase services to
work as expected.

Cloud Firestore, Firebase Crash Reporting, and Firebase Performance

the [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20180502).

#### Play Services updates
- Google Play services libraries after 15.0.0 now have independent version
numbers which follow [SemVer](https://semver.org/). This change will allow for more
frequent, flexible updates by individual components.
- The [Google Services Gradle plugin](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/google-services-plugin)
has been updated to version 3.3.0 to support this change in versioning. If
you do not use this plugin, a standalone plugin,
`com.google.android.gms.strict-version-matcher-plugin` has been released with
the same version support functionality. For more details, see
[versioning guide](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/versioning).

## April 12, 2018 - Version 15.0.0
**Known Issues with version 15.0.0**

- If you are using the [Android Plugin for Gradle](https://developer.android.com/studio/releases/gradle-plugin.html) version 2.2.0 or lower, you may encounter the following error:

`Error: more than one library with package name 'com.google.android.gms'`

To resolve the issue, update to a more recent version of the plugin.


Highlights from the v 15.0.0 release:

#### Play Services updates
- A new version of the `com.google.gms.oss.licenses.plugin` Gradle plugin is now
available. Please update as only this latest version works with Google Play
services 15.0.0 and beyond. This is the last version of the plugin to support
Android Studio 2.x. Starting with the next version, the plugin will support
Android Studio 3.x only.

- All references to `com.google.android.gms.R` classes have been replaced by
component specific references; for example, `com.google.android.gms.ads.R`.
If you use these classes directly in your code, you may need to update your
code to be compatible.

- Starting with 15.0.0, there will no longer be an updated offline Javadoc
(the Google Play services artifact in Android Studioâ€™s SDK Manager).

- Starting with 15.0.0, there will no longer be a `play-services` alias target
to pull in all Google Play services components. This has been recommended
against for some time.

#### Ads
- Added the [`UnifiedNativeAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/UnifiedNativeAd) class, which can contain either an app install ad or a content ad.
- Updated the Native Ads Advanced API to support `UnifiedNativeAd`:
 - Added the [`UnifiedNativeAdView`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/UnifiedNativeAdView) and [`UnifiedNativeAdAssetNames`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/UnifiedNativeAdAssetNames) classes.
 - Added the [`UnifiedNativeAd.OnUnifiedNativeAdLoadedListener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/UnifiedNativeAd.OnUnifiedNativeAdLoadedListener) interface.
 - Added the [`forUnifiedNativeAd()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdLoader.Builder#forUnifiedNativeAd(com.google.android.gms.ads.formats.UnifiedNativeAd.OnUnifiedNativeAdLoadedListener)) method to the [`AdLoader.Builder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdLoader.Builder) class.
 - Made several updates to the mediation API, making it possible for adapters and custom events to return instances of `UnifiedNativeAd`.

#### Auth
- Added the [`KEY_EXTRA_ACCOUNT_TYPE`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/accounttransfer/AccountTransfer#KEY_EXTRA_ACCOUNT_TYPE) constant to the [`AccountTransfer`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/accounttransfer/AccountTransfer) class, which lets packages know which account type should be addressed.

#### Cast
- Deprecated the [`AppVisibilityListener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/AppVisibilityListener) class.
- Deprecated [`RemoteMediaClient.Listener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient.Listener) class. Use the new [`RemoteMediaClient.Callback`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient.Callback) class instead.
- Fixed a crash in [`TracksChooserDialogFragment`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/TracksChooserDialogFragment) and made several changes to its constructor and creator.
- Introduced the [`MediaQueue`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/MediaQueue) API as a replacement for existing media queue mechanism. Use the new [`MediaQueueRecyclerViewAdapter`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/MediaQueueRecyclerViewAdapter) and [`MediaQueueArrayAdapter`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/MediaQueueArrayAdapter) classes to access `MediaQueue` in recycler views and list views, respectively.
- Tapping cast remote control notifications now take users to the Google Home app or the corresponding Cast app, depending on if the Cast app supports joining the session automatically.
- Ads Support Update:
 - Cast Sender API now supports loading `VAST` ads.
 - Added "Skip Ad" button and countdown text UI elements.
- Added a version of [`CastContext.getSharedInstance()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/CastContext#getSharedInstance()) that doesn't require `Context` as parameter.
- Fixed an `IllegalStateException` crash in CAF.
- Added [`DEVICE_CONNECTION_SUSPENDED`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/CastStatusCodes#DEVICE_CONNECTION_SUSPENDED) to [`CastStatusCodes`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/CastStatusCodes) for `PendingResult`.
- For more details, see [`Google Cast release notes`](https://developers.google.com/cast/docs/release-notes).

#### Firebase
- The latest update to Firebase includes additions to Firebase Authentication and Firebase Cloud Storage. For more information, see
[Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20180412).

#### Fitness
- Deprecated the [`fromLocationRequest()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/request/SensorRequest#fromLocationRequest(com.google.android.gms.fitness.data.DataSource,%20com.google.android.gms.location.LocationRequest)) method of the [`SensorRequest`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/request/SensorRequest) class. Use [SensorRequest.Builder](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/request/SensorRequest.Builder) to build SensorRequest instead.

#### Google Cloud Messaging
- Deprecated the [`GoogleCloudMessaging`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/gcm/GoogleCloudMessaging), [`GcmPubSub`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/gcm/GcmPubSub), [`GcmReceiver`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/gcm/GcmReceiver), [`GcmListenerService`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/gcm/GcmListenerService), [`InstanceID`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/iid/InstanceID), and [`InstanceIDListenerService`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/iid/InstanceIDListenerService) classes. Use [`FirebaseMessaging`](https://firebase.google.com/docs/reference/android/com/google/firebase/messaging/FirebaseMessaging) instead.

#### Games
- Deprecated the [`getChurnProbability()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/stats/PlayerStats#getChurnProbability()), PlayerStats.getHighSpenderProbability, [`getSpendProbability()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/stats/PlayerStats#getSpendProbability()), and [`getTotalSpendNext28Days()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/stats/PlayerStats#getTotalSpendNext28Days()) methods from the [`PlayerStats`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/stats/PlayerStats) class.

#### Instant Apps
- Removed `InstantApps.API`. Use [`InstantApps.getInstantAppsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/instantapps/InstantApps#getInstantAppsClient(android.app.Activity)) instead.

#### Nearby
- Deprecated [`NearbyConnections`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/Connections)-related internal states.

#### Wallet
- Deprecated the [`Payments`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/Payments) class. Instead, use [`Wallet.getPaymentsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/Wallet#getPaymentsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.wallet.Wallet.WalletOptions)) to get an instance of the new [`PaymentsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentsClient) class.

## March 28, 2018 - Version 12.0.1
Issues fixed in 12.0.1:

- Fixes issue that caused spurious Android lint errors claiming `GoogleSignIn` and `CredentialsClient` were internal-only.
- Adds missing `minSdkVersion` in -license artifacts to prevent automatic inclusion of `READ_PHONE_STATE` and `READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` permissions.
- Restores unique package names for runtime linked -license artifacts which affected some build systems' (e.g. Ionic Pro) compatibility issues.
- Restores some fields names that were obfuscated in 12.0.1, namely the `value()` method of `@PropertyName` annotations in firebase-firestore and firebase-database.

## March 20, 2018 - Version 12.0.0
**Known Issues with version 12.0.0**

- -license POM dependencies have no `minSdkVersion` / `targetSdkVersion` set, which means that the implied `targetSdkVersion` is 1. This adds `READ_PHONE_STATE` and `READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` permissions for apps using 12.0.0.
- -license POM dependencies cause "more than one library with package name â€˜com.google.android.gms.license'" issues in Ionic Pro.
- `@PropertyName` annotations for firebase-database and firebase-firestore have their `value()` method obfuscated. This means your app will not build if you use `@PropertyName`.
- An annotation causes spurious lint errors claiming `GoogleSignIn` and `CredentialsClient` are internal-only. These can safely be ignored.

We will provide an updated 12.0.1 release to address these issues soon.

Highlights from the Google Play services 12.0.0 release:

- **Ads**

 - Added the [`trackViews()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper#trackViews(android.view.View,%20java.util.Map%3Cjava.lang.String,%20android.view.View%3E,%20java.util.Map%3Cjava.lang.String,%20android.view.View%3E)) method to the [`NativeAdMapper`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper) class. The method replaces the now-deprecated [`trackView()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper#trackView(android.view.View)) method of the same class.
- **Auth**

 - Deprecated the [`Auth.AuthCredentialsOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/Auth.AuthCredentialsOptions) class in favor of the new [`CredentialsOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/CredentialsOptions) class.
- **Cast**

 - Improved Ads support:
 - Added the [`setAdBreakClips()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/MediaInfo.Builder#setAdBreakClips(java.util.List%3Ccom.google.android.gms.cast.AdBreakClipInfo%3E)) and [`setAdBreaks()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/MediaInfo.Builder#setAdBreaks(java.util.List%3Ccom.google.android.gms.cast.AdBreakInfo%3E)) methods to the [`MediaInfo.Builder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/MediaInfo.Builder) class to provide a way to send ad break and clip info in a media load request.
 - Updated the [`AdBreakInfo.Builder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/AdBreakInfo.Builder) class and added the [`AdBreakClipInfo`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/AdBreakClipInfo.Builder) class to facilitate new break- and clip-sending methods.
 - Added support for new voice cast APIs:
 - Added the `setCredentials()` and `setCredentialsType()` methods to the `MeadiaLoadOptions.Builder` class and the `getCredentials()` and `getCredentialsType()` methods to the `MediaLoadOptions` class. The methods allow you to set and get application-specific credentials with load requests.
 - Added the [`getEntity()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/MediaInfo#getEntity()) method to the [`MediaInfo`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/MediaInfo) class. The entity represents a deep link for media loading from Google Assistant.
 - Fixed a bug where calling [`CastContext.getSharedInstance()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/CastContext#getSharedInstance(android.content.Context)) on devices with out-of-date versions of Google Play services caused a crash. Outdated Google Play services versions still cause the method to fail, so clients should check for an appropriate version.
- **Fido**


## March 20, 2018 - Version 12.0.0

 - The Fast Identity Online 2.0 (Fido2) API is now available to early access partners. Since the API is still early-access, breaking changes can be made without warning. For the sake of your app's stability, don't rely on this API until it's more generally available.
- **Firebase**

 - The latest update to Firebase includes additions to Firebase Authentication, Firebase Cloud Messaging, Firestore, and Firebase Functions. For more information, see
 [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20180320).
- **Instant Apps**

 - Added new a [`Launcher`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/instantapps/Launcher) API, to check a supplied URL and launch an instant app if one is found.
- **Location**

 - Added the [`ActivityTransition`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/ActivityTransition) class to help apps differentiate between different physical activities users undertake, for example walking, running, or driving.
 - Added the [`BoundsMode`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/places/GeoDataClient.BoundsMode) interface to allow the [`getAutocompletePredictions()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/places/GeoDataClient#getAutocompletePredictions(java.lang.String,%20com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLngBounds,%20int,%20com.google.android.gms.location.places.AutocompleteFilter)) method to enable searches with bounds restrictions.
- **Maps**

 - Added the [`StreetViewSource`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/maps/model/StreetViewSource) class, which lets you restrict Streetview searches to outdoor-only results.
 - For a full list of features, bug fixes, and other notes, see the [Maps Android API Release Notes](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/android-sdk/releases).
- **Nearby**

 - Deprecated the [`GoogleApiClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApiClient)-based [`Messages`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/messages/Messages) and [`Connections`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/Connections) interfaces. Use the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, [`MessagesClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/messages/MessagesClient) and [`ConnectionsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/ConnectionsClient) instead.

## December 18, 2017 - Version 11.8.0
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.8.0 release:

- **Auth**

 - The [`WorkAccountApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/account/WorkAccountApi) class is now deprecated. Use [`WorkAccountClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/account/WorkAccountClient) via [`WorkAccount.getClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/account/WorkAccount#getClient(android.app.Activity)) instead.
- **Cast**

 - Made the following changes to the [`UIMediaController`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController) class:
 - When views are bound to `UIMediaController`, the controller now registers listeners that call one of the following event handling methods in response to user interactions, as appropriate:
 - [`onMuteToggleClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onMuteToggleClicked(android.widget.ImageView))
 - [`onPlayPauseToggleClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onPlayPauseToggleClicked(android.widget.ImageView))
 - [`onSeekBarStopTrackingTouch()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onSeekBarStopTrackingTouch(android.widget.SeekBar))
 - [`onSeekBarStartTrackingTouch()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onSeekBarStartTrackingTouch(android.widget.SeekBar))
 - [`onSeekBarProgressChanged()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onSeekBarProgressChanged(android.widget.SeekBar,%20int,%20boolean))
 - [`onCloseCaptionClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onClosedCaptionClicked(android.view.View))
 - [`onLaunchExpandedControllerClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onClosedCaptionClicked(android.view.View))
 - [`onForwardClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onForwardClicked(android.view.View,%20long))
 - [`onRewindClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onRewindClicked(android.view.View,%20long))
 - [`onSkipNextClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onSkipNextClicked(android.view.View))
 - [`onSkipPrevClicked()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/uicontroller/UIMediaController#onSkipPrevClicked(android.view.View))
 - Override any of the above the event handling methods to customize their behavior.
 - Improved documentation to clarify the underlying implementation of `UIMediaController`.
 - Inverted the mute toggle button display so that it shows a speaker icon when unmuted and a crossed speaker icon when muted.
 - The Cast SDK for Android now supports [Instant apps](https://developer.android.com/topic/instant-apps/overview.html).
- **Firebase**

 - The latest update to Firebase includes additions to Firebase Appindexing, Firebase Authentication, Firebase Cloud Messaging, and Firebase Performance Monitoring. For more information, see
 [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20171218).
- **Location**


## December 18, 2017 - Version 11.8.0

 - Added the [`KEY_VERTICAL_ACCURACY`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/FusedLocationProviderClient#KEY_VERTICAL_ACCURACY) constant, which indicates the estimated vertical accuracy of a location.
- **Wallet**

 - Updated the [`isReadyToPay()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentsClient#isReadyToPay(com.google.android.gms.wallet.IsReadyToPayRequest)) method to offer a option for an extra check that ensures the user has an existing payment method.
- **Wearable**

 - Updated the Wearable API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:

 - Added the [`CapabilityClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/CapabilityClient) class and the [`Wearable.getCapabilityClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable#getCapabilityClient(android.app.Activity)) method to replace the [`CapabilityApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/CapabilityApi) interface as a way to to learn about capabilities provided by nodes on the Wear network.
 - Added the [`ChannelClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/ChannelClient) class and the [`Wearable.getChallenClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable#getChannelClient(android.app.Activity)) method to replace the [`ChannelApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/ChannelApi) interface as a way to send and receive data from wearable nodes.
 - Added the [`DataClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/DataClient) class and the [`Wearable.getDataClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable#getDataClient(android.app.Activity)) method to replace the [`DataApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/DataApi) interface as a way to read and write data items and assets.
 - Added the [`MessageClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/MessageClient) class and the [`Wearable.getMessageClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable#getMessageClient(android.app.Activity)) method to replace the [`MessageApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/MessageApi) interface as a way to send messages to other nodes.
 - Added the [`NodeClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/NodeClient) class and the [`Wearable.getNodeClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable#getNodeClient(android.app.Activity)) method to replace the [`NodeApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/NodeApi) interface as a way to learn about connected nodes.
 - API calls return `Task ` instead of `PendingResult `

 - [`ChannelClient.ChannelCallback`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/ChannelClient.ChannelCallback) replaces [`ChannelApi.ChannelListener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/ChannelApi.ChannelListener).


## December 18, 2017 - Version 11.8.0

 - [`WearableOptions.Builder.setLooper()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wearable/Wearable.WearableOptions.Builder#setLooper(android.os.Looper)) replaces [`GoogleApiClient.Builder.setHandler()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApiClient.Builder#setHandler(android.os.Handler)) to set the thread for listener callbacks in the new API Client classes.

For more information about the latest Wearable API release, see the [Android Wear Release Notes](https://developer.android.com/wear/releases/index.html) page.

**Resolved issue in version 11.8.0**

`GoogleApi` instances created with a `Context` in apps with targetSdkVersion 26 now automatically prompt users to update Google Play services, resolving that known issue from 11.6.0.

## November 27, 2017 - Version 11.6.2
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.6.2 release:

- **Firebase**

 - The latest update to Firebase includes additions to Cloud Firestore and Cloud Storage for Firebase. For more information, see
 [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20171127).

## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.6 release:

- **Ads**

 - Added the [`NativeAdViewHolder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeAdViewHolder) class, an alternative way to show Native Ads.
 - Deprecated the [`AdLoader.getMediationAdapterClassName()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/AdLoader#getMediationAdapterClassName()) method. Publishers should use the recently introduced [`NativeAppInstallAd.getMediationAdapterClassName()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeAppInstallAd#getMediationAdapterClassName()) or [`NativeContentAd.getMediationAdapterClassName()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeContentAd#getMediationAdapterClassName()) instead.
 - Un-deprecated the [`RewardedVideoAd.setUserId()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/reward/RewardedVideoAd#setUserId(java.lang.String)) method for use with server-to-server reward verification.
- **Auth**

 - Updated the Auth API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`CredentialsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/CredentialsClient) and [`Credentials`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/Credentials) classes. `CredentialsClient` provides the entry point for requesting a credential and indicating whether sign-in was successful using the credential.
 - Added the [`GoogleSignInClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/signin/GoogleSignInClient) and [`GoogleSignIn`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/signin/GoogleSignIn) classes. `GoogleSignInClient` provides the entry point for interacting with the Google Sign In API.
 - Added the [`GoogleAuthUtil.requestGoogleAccountsAccess()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/GoogleAuthUtil#requestGoogleAccountsAccess(android.content.Context)) method. The method makes all Google accounts installed on the device visible to the caller in Android O, if the user provides consent.
 - Added the [`AuthCredentialsOptions.Builder.forceEnableSaveDialog()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/Auth.AuthCredentialsOptions.Builder#forceEnableSaveDialog()) method. The method fixes an issue on Android O and above devices where the [`Auth.Api.Credential`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/Credential) save confirmation dialog sometimes wasn't shown in favor of the active Autofill serviceâ€™s save dialog. The added method to overrides that default behaviour.
- **Awareness**


## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0

 - Updated the Awareness API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`FenceClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/FenceClient) class and the [`Awareness.getFenceClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/Awareness#getFenceClient(android.app.Activity)) methods. Use `FenceClient` instead of [`FenceApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/FenceApi).
 - Added the [`SnapshotClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotClient) class and the [`Awareness.getSnapshotClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/Awareness#getSnapshotClient(android.app.Activity)) methods. Use `SnapshotClient` instead of [`SnapshotApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotApi).
- **Cast**

 - Made the following changes to methods in the [`RemoteMediaClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient) class:
 - Added the [`load(MediaInfo, MediaLoadOptions)`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient#load(com.google.android.gms.cast.MediaInfo,%20com.google.android.gms.cast.MediaLoadOptions)) method.
 - Deprecated other `load()` methods.
 - Added the methods [`setPlaybackRate(double)`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient#setPlaybackRate(double)) and [`setPlaybackRate(double, JSONObject)`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/media/RemoteMediaClient#setPlaybackRate(double,%20org.json.JSONObject)). Call these methods to set the variable playback rate for the current media item.
 - For more details, see [Google Cast release notes](https://developers.google.com/cast/docs/release-notes).
- **Drive**


## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0

 - Updated the Drive API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`DriveClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveClient) class and the [`Drive.getDriveClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/Drive#getDriveClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `DriveClient` provides the entry point for general interactions with the Drive API.
 - Added the [`DriveResourceClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveResourceClient) class and the [`Drive.getDriveResourceClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/Drive#getDriveResourceClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `DriveResourceClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with a [`DriveResource`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveResource) (i.e. a [`DriveFile`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveFile) or a [`DriveFolder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveFolder)).
 - Added [`CreateFileActivityOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/CreateFileActivityOptions) and [`OpenFileActivityOptions`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/OpenFileActivityOptions) objects that can be passed to the new [`DriveClient.newCreateFileActivityIntentSender()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveClient#newCreateFileActivityIntentSender(com.google.android.gms.drive.CreateFileActivityOptions)) and [`DriveClient.newOpenFileActivityIntentSender()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveClient#newOpenFileActivityIntentSender(com.google.android.gms.drive.OpenFileActivityOptions)) methods to create the respective file pickers.
 - Deprecated [`GoogleApiClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApiClient) API methods accessed via [`DriveApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveApi), [`DrivePreferencesApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DrivePreferencesApi), [`DriveContents`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveContents), [`DriveResource`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveResource), [`DriveFolder`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveFolder), and [`DriveFile`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveFile).

 - The latest update to Firebase includes additions to Authentication, Dynamic Links, and Cloud Messaging. For more information, see
 [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20171030).
- **Fitness**


## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0

 - Updated the Fitness API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`BleClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/BleClient) class and the [`Fitness.getBleClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getBleClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `BleClient` provides the entry point for scanning, claiming, and using Bluetooth Low Energy devices in Google Fit.
 - Added the [`ConfigClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/ConfigClient) class and the [`Fitness.getConfigClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getConfigClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `ConfigClient` provides the entry point for accessing custom data types and settings in Google Fit.
 - Added the [`GoalsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/GoalsClient) class and the [`Fitness.getGoalsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getGoalsClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `GoalsClient` provides the entry point for reading fitness [`Goal`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/Goal) s created by users in Google Fit.
 - Added the [`HistoryClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/HistoryClient) class and the [`Fitness.getHistoryClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getHistoryClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `HistoryClient` provides the entry point for inserting, deleting, and reading data in Google Fit.
 - Added the [`RecordingClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/RecordingClient) class and the [`Fitness.getRecordingClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getRecordingClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `RecordingClient` provides the entry point for enabling low-power, always-on background collection of sensor data in Google Fit.
 - Added the [`SensorsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/SensorsClient) class and the [`Fitness.getSensorsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getSensorsClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `SensorsClient` provides the entry point for exposing different sources of fitness data in local and connected devices, and delivering live events to listeners.
 - Added the [`SessionsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/SessionsClient) clas and the [`getSessionsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/Fitness#getSessionsClient(android.content.Context,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `SessionsClient` provides the entry point for creating and managing [`Session`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/fitness/data/Session) s of user activity in Google Fit.
- **Games**


## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0

 - Updated the Games API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`AchievementsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/AchievementsClient) class and the [`Games.getAchievementsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getAchievementsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `AchievementsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with achievements functionality.
 - Added the [`EventsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/EventsClient) class and the [`Games.getEventsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getEventsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `EventsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with events functionality.
 - Added the [`GamesClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesClient) class and the [`Games.getGamesClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getGamesClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `GamesClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with games basic functionality.
 - Added the [`GamesMetadataClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesMetadataClient) class and the [`Games.getGamesMetadataClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getGamesMetadataClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `GamesMetadataClient` provides the entry point for API methods to retrieve game metadata.
 - Added the [`InvitationsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/InvitationsClient) class and the [`Games.getInvitationsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getInvitationsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `InvitationsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with invitations functionality.
 - Added the [`LeaderboardsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/LeaderboardsClient) class and the [`Games.getLeaderboardsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getLeaderboardsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `LeaderboardsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with leaderboards functionality.
 - Added the [`NotificationsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/NotificationsClient) class and the [`Games.getNotificationsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getNotificationsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `NotificationsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with Notifications.
 - Added the [`PlayerStatsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/PlayerStatsClient) class and the [`Games.getPlayerStatsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getPlayerStatsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods.

## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0
 `PlayerStatsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that provides the entry point for API methods to retrieve Player stats.
 - Added the [`PlayersClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/PlayersClient) class and the [`Games.getPlayersClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getPlayersClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `PlayersClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with Players.
 - Added the [`RealTimeMultiplayerClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/RealTimeMultiplayerClient) class and the [`Games.getRealTimeMultiplayerClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getRealTimeMultiplayerClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `RealTimeMultiplayerClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with real time multiplayer functionality.
 - Added the [`SnapshotsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/SnapshotsClient) class and the [`Games.getSnapshotsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getSnapshotsClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `SnapshotsClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with Shapshots.
 - Added the [`TurnBasedMultiplayerClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/TurnBasedMultiplayerClient) class and the [`Games.getTurnBasedMultiplayerClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getTurnBasedMultiplayerClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `TurnBasedMultiplayerClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with turn based multiplayer.
 - Added the [`VideosClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/VideosClient) class and the [`Games.getVideosClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Games#getVideosClient(android.app.Activity,%20com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount)) methods. `VideosClient` provides the entry point for API methods that interact with videos.
 - Deprecated API entry points: [`Achievements`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/achievement/Achievements), [`Events`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/event/Events), [`GamesMetadata`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/GamesMetadata), [`Invitations`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/multiplayer/Invitations), [`Leaderboards`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/leaderboard/Leaderboards), [`Notifications`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Notifications), [`Stats`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/stats/Stats), [`Players`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/Players), [`RealTimeMultiplayer`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/multiplayer/realtime/RealTimeMultiplayer), [`Snapshots`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/snapshot/Snapshots), [`TurnBasedMultiplayer`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/multiplayer/turnbased/TurnBasedMultiplayer), and [`Videos`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/games/video/Videos).
- **Location**


## November 6, 2017 - version 11.6.0

 - Fixed [`FusedLocationProviderClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/FusedLocationProviderClient) issue that occasionally caused crashes when Google Play services updated.
 - Deprecated the [`AddPlaceRequest`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/places/AddPlaceRequest) class the [`GeoDataApi.addPlace()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/places/GeoDataApi) and [`GeoDataClient.addPlace()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/places/GeoDataClient) methods. `AddPlaceRequest` will be removed on June 30, 2018.
- **Nearby**

 - Updated the Nearby API for the new [`GoogleApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/GoogleApi)-based clients, which automatically manage connections to services and require less boilerplate code to use:
 - Added the [`ConnectionClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/ConnectionsClient) class and the [`Nearby.getConnectionsClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/Nearby#getConnectionsClient(android.content.Context)) methods. `ConnectionClient` provides the entry point for advertising and discovering nearby apps and services, and communicating with them over established connections.
 - Added the [`MessagesClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/messages/MessagesClient) class and the [`Nearby.getMessagesClient()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/Nearby#getMessagesClient(android.app.Activity)) methods. `MessagesClient` provides the entry point for publishing simple messages and subscribing to receive those messages from nearby devices.
 - Added the [`Connections.cancelPayload()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/Connections#cancelPayload(com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient,%20long)) method, which a [`Payload`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/nearby/connection/Payload) currently in-flight to or from remote endpoints.
- **Wallet**

 - [`getPaymentMethodTokenizationParameters`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentDataRequest#getPaymentMethodTokenizationParameters()) and [`getTransactionInfo`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentDataRequest#getTransactionInfo()) are no longer required fields. When they aren't set, the Google Payment API doesn't return a chargeable token. Avoid setting these fields in flows where users are only attempting to change selections without making a purchase (e.g. within an appâ€™s Payment Settings).
 - Changed the [`resolveTask()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/AutoResolveHelper#resolveTask(com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task%3CTResult%3E,%20android.app.Activity,%20int)) method to add a temporary Fragment to an activity. Ensure the Activity can execute fragment transactions without state loss before calling the method. Most developers should be unaffected by this change, as `resolveTask()` is usually called within a button click listener.

**Known Issues with version 11.6.0**

`GoogleApi` instances created with a `Context` in apps with targetSdkVersion 26 won't automatically prompt users to update Google Play services. Consider using [`GoogleApiAvailability.showErrorDialogFragment()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/GoogleApiAvailability.html#showErrorDialogFragment(android.app.Activity,%20int,%20int)) under these conditions instead.

## October 3, 2017 - version 11.4.2
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.4.2. release:

- **Cloud Firestore**
 - The initial public beta release of Cloud Firestore is now available.
 Cloud Firestore is a flexible, scalable database for mobile, web, and
 server development from Firebase and Google Cloud Platform. Like
 Firebase Realtime Database, it keeps your data in sync across client apps
 through realtime listeners and offers offline support so you can build
 responsive apps that work regardless of network latency or internet
 connectivity. Cloud Firestore also offers enterprise-grade scalability and
 seamless integration with other Firebase and Google Cloud Platform
 products, including Cloud Functions. For more information about
 Cloud Firestore, see the
 [Firebase blog](https://firebase.googleblog.com/2017/10/introducing-cloud-firestore.html).
 To get started with Cloud Firestore right away, visit the
 [quickstart](https://firebase.google.com/docs/firestore/quickstart).

## September 2017 - version 11.4.0
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.4 release.

- **Ads**

 - Added `getMediationAdapterClassName()` methods to the [`NativeAppInstallAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeAppInstallAd#getMediationAdapterClassName()) and [`NativeContentAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/formats/NativeContentAd#getMediationAdapterClassName()) classes. The method of the same name in AdLoader will be deprecated.
 - Added methods to several classes to support native video mediation:
 - [`MediationNativeListener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/MediationNativeListener): [`onVideoEnd()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/MediationNativeListener#onVideoEnd(com.google.android.gms.ads.mediation.MediationNativeAdapter))
 - [`NativeAdMapper`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper): [`hasVideoContent()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper#hasVideoContent()), [`setHasVideoContent()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper#setHasVideoContent(boolean)), and [`setMediaView()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeAdMapper#setMediaView(android.view.View))
 - [`NativeMediationAdRequest`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeMediationAdRequest): [`getAdVolume()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeMediationAdRequest#getAdVolume()) and [`isAdMuted()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/mediation/NativeMediationAdRequest#isAdMuted())
 - Removed the `SearchAdRequest` class.
- **Analytics**

 - Added a new class [`AnalyticsJobService`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/analytics/AnalyticsJobService). This class provides compatibility support for Android O and is used by Analytics to upload data. No action is necessary to use this class, itâ€™s added automatically as part of the Analytics package.
 - Deprecated the `getContext()` method of the [`AnalyticsService`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/analytics/AnalyticsService) class.
 - Deprecated the [`CampaignTrackingService`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/analytics/CampaignTrackingService) class.
- **Auth**

 - The hint selector now sends the [`ACTIVITY_RESULT_NO_HINTS_AVAILABLE`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/auth/api/credentials/CredentialsApi#ACTIVITY_RESULT_NO_HINTS_AVAILABLE) result when the user has no hint information saved.
- **Awareness**


## September 2017 - version 11.4.0

 - Added the following classes:
 - [`BeaconStateResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/BeaconStateResponse)
 - [`DetectedActivityResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/DetectedActivityResponse)
 - [`FenceClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/FenceClient)
 - [`FenceQueryResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/fence/FenceQueryResponse)
 - [`HeadphoneStateResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/HeadphoneStateResponse)
 - [`LocationResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/LocationResponse)
 - [`PlacesResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/PlacesResponse)
 - [`SnapshotClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/SnapshotClient)
 - [`WeatherResponse`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/awareness/snapshot/WeatherResponse)
- **Cast**


 - Added a new class [`PrecacheManager`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/PrecacheManager). This class provides methods to pre-cache the content that users intend to consume in order to reduce the loading time.
 - Added the [`getPrecacheManager()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/CastContext#getPrecacheManager()) method to the [`CastContext`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/CastContext) class for your app to get the instance of the [`PrecacheManager`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/PrecacheManager) class.
 - Added the [`startSession(Intent)`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/SessionManager#startSession(android.content.Intent)) to the [`SessionManager`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/SessionManager) class. Call this method to join a cast session when the sender app is launched by an implicit intent.

For more detail, see the [Cast API release notes](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/cast/framework/SessionManager).

- **Common**

 - Added the [`checkApiAvailability()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/GoogleApiAvailability#checkApiAvailability(com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApi%3C?%3E,%20com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApi%3C?%3E...)) method to the [`GoogleApiAvailability`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/GoogleApiAvailability) class. The method returns a task that asynchronously checks if specified APIs are available. If one or more aren't available, the task fails with an [`AvailabilityException`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/common/api/AvailabilityException) that you can query for individual API availability.
- **Drive**

 - Removed `cancelPendingActions()` from the [`DriveApi`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/drive/DriveApi) interface.
- **Firebase**

 - The latest update to Firebase includes additions to App Indexing and Authentication. For more information, see
 [Firebase Android SDK Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android#20170918).
- **Maps**


## September 2017 - version 11.4.0

 - Use the new [`GoogleMap.OnMyLocationClickListener`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/maps/GoogleMap.OnMyLocationClickListener) to detect when the user clicks the My Location blue dot. For details, see the developerâ€™s guide to the [My Location layer](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/android-sdk/location#my-location).
- **Nearby**

 - `BLUETOOTH`, `BLUETOOTH_ADMIN`, `ACCESS_WIFI_STATE`, and `CHANGE_WIFI_STATE` permissions are now required for Nearby Connections.
- **Oss licenses**

 - Added support for hyperlinks in license content.
 - Added the [`setActivityTitle()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/oss/licenses/OssLicensesMenuActivity#setActivityTitle(java.lang.String)) method to the [`OssLicensesMenuActivity`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/oss/licenses/OssLicensesMenuActivity) class, which makes it easier to set custom activity titles. Deprecated the previous title-setting approach.
- **Wallet**


 - Introduced a new Google Payment API, defined in the [`PaymentsClient`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentsClient) class. Noteworthy differences:
 - The [`loadPaymentData()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentsClient#loadPaymentData(com.google.android.gms.wallet.PaymentDataRequest)) method replaces the [`loadFullWallet()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/Payments#loadFullWallet(com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient,%20com.google.android.gms.wallet.FullWalletRequest,%20int)) and [`loadMaskedWallet()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/Payments#loadMaskedWallet(com.google.android.gms.common.api.GoogleApiClient,%20com.google.android.gms.wallet.MaskedWalletRequest,%20int)) methods from the [`Payments`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/Payments) class.
 - The [`isReadyToPay()`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/wallet/PaymentsClient#isReadyToPay(com.google.android.gms.wallet.IsReadyToPayRequest)) method allows callers to specify which payment methods are supported.

Fore more information, check out the [new Payment API](http://developers.google.com/payments).

## August 2017 - version 11.2.0
Highlights from the Google Play services 11.2 release.

- **Google Play services updated to 11.2.2** In this release:

 - Fixes for minor issues in Firebase Performance Monitoring. To learn more,
 see the
 [Firebase Android Release Notes](https://firebase.google.com/support/release-notes/android).
 - Added a new `loadAd()` method that takes in a
 [`PublisherAdRequest`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/doubleclick/PublisherAdRequest)
 object to the
 [`RewardedVideoAd`](https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/ads/reward/RewardedVideoAd)
 class.
 - New OSS licenses library simplifies displaying licenses for dependencies
 in Google Play services and other libraries. To learn more, see the guide
 [Including Open Source Notices](https://developers.google.com/android/guides/opensource).
- **Google Play services dependencies are now available via maven.google.com**

Dependencies are now available directly from `maven.google.com`. You can
update your appâ€™s Gradle build scripts to use this repository by
configuring the build as follows:


```
allprojects {
 repositories {
 jcenter()
 google()
 }
}

```


For more information on this change, see the [accompanying blog post](https://developers.google.com/developers.google.com).
For further details about the Google maven repository, see
[Add Build Dependencies](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/dependencies.html#google-maven)
in the Android documentation.

- **SDK Version Support in 11.2**

When you upgrade your appâ€™s Play services dependencies to 11.2.0 or later,
your appâ€™s `build.gradle` must also be updated to specify a
`compileSdkVersion` of at least 26 (Android O). This does not change the way
your app runs. You will not be required to update `targetSdkVersion`. If you
update `compileSdkVersion` to 26, you may receive an error in your build with
the following message referring to the Android support library:


```
Thissupportlibraryshouldshouldnotuseadifferentversion(25)thanthecompileSdkVersion(26).
```
